results.title: Central perspectives (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Art Landy and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Reviews the definition of range and pencil. Introduces the basic projective transformation, namely the central perspectivity. When the narrator poses the question of the number of points required to uniquely determine a projectivity (product of perspectivity) the viewer is led to the fundamental theorem of projective geometry.

results.title: Central America (Caribbean region II)
results.brief_description: The climate, geography, economic interdependence on the rest of the world, the industries, and the peoples of Central America, are studied briefly in this film. The region’s position and importance in the Carribbean area, and its political history from the time of Columbus to the present, are sketched with the aid of animated diagrams.

results.title: The Centenary test
results.brief_description: This film consists of highlights from the 1977 Centenary Test Match played at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, March 12th-17th, between Australia and England. It contains interviews by Richie Benaud with former and current players of both teams and commentators include Norman May, Frank Tyson, Jim Laker, Keith Miller and Paul Sheahan.

results.title: Centaur
results.creator_credit: Susan Gibbard, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The camera-work, music and colours of this film combine to express the joy of horses and horsemanship. Filmed with members of the Canadian Equestrian Team and designed to capture the essence of the sport where horse and rider seem to move as one. (Awards: Reims, Yorkton, Chantilly)

results.title: Celluloid college: basic motion picture technique
results.creator_credit: Emil E. Brodbeck, Roy Creveling and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: An instructional film for amateur movie makers; includes demonstrations and explanations of panning, using the tripod; shot break down; screen direction; matching; newsreel shooting; build-up; composition; indoor lighting. Concludes by presenting an amusing short play in which all the techniques emphasized in the film are incorporated.

results.title: The Cell
results.creator_credit: Jim Stephenson and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows chemical events which take place within the living cell. Presents the various protein functions, including D.N.A. and genetic coding, discusses mitochondrian and chloroplasts, and investigates cellular communication.
results.description: Shows chemical events which take place within the living cell. Presents the various protein functions, including D.N.A. and genetic coding, discusses mitochondrian and chloroplasts, and investigates cellular communication.

results.title: Celebration of life: trees
results.creator_credit: Paul Fillinger and Paul Fillinger Productions
results.brief_description: The beauty and wonder of our natural environment gives cause for a celebration. The viewer joins a group of youngsters discovering and enjoying everything about trees and forests. It is a reminder of the people-nature activities that can be enjoyed. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Cave community
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains why the relatively unchanging environment of caves provides biologists with important data. Shows the evolutionary and adaptive modifications of cave dwelling bats, fish, insects and salamanders.

results.title: The Cave: a parable told by Orson Welles
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow and Counterpoint Films
results.brief_description: An animated dramatization based on “The Allegory of the Cave” from Book 7 of Plato’s “Republic” illustrating mankind’s escape from the world of illusion to the world of reality. Four men chained in a cave take images reflected on a wall for the truth. Narrated by Orson Welles.

results.title: Cavalcade of Australia
results.brief_description: On the celebration of Australia’s Jubilee as a Commonwealth, Australian film production organisations, both government and commercial, made available for this film archival material from their libraries. The film shows highlights of the important events of the first 50 years of the Federation. Music by Sydney John Kay.
